name: Vilakazi Street Walk
description: The only street globally where two Nobel laureates—Nelson Mandela and Desmond Tutu—lived. It's lined with vibrant restaurants, art, and township life.
address: Vilakazi Street, Orlando West, Soweto, Johannesburg 1804, South Africa

name: Mandela House Museum
cost: Adults R180; Youth (7–18) R70; Children under 7 free
description: Nelson Mandela's former home (1946–1962), now a museum preserving personal artifacts and South African history.

name: Tutu House
description: Residence of Archbishop Desmond Tutu. A key heritage landmark on Vilakazi Street.

name: Orlando Towers – Bungee Jump
cost: R630 per person (R580 for groups ≥6); optional photos R100 / video R170
description: 100m bungee jump between colorful cooling towers—an iconic Soweto thrill.
address: Cnr Sheffield Rd & Chris Hani Rd, Orlando East, Soweto

name: Orlando Towers – SCAD Freefall
cost: R400 per person (R360 for groups); includes photos/videos
description: Strap in and freefall inside a tower—one of the few SCAD experiences in the world.
address: Cnr Sheffield Rd & Chris Hani Rd, Orlando East, Soweto

name: Orlando Towers – Paintball
description: Urban-style paintball arena for fun group challenges at the base of the towers.
address: Cnr Sheffield Rd & Chris Hani Rd, Orlando East, Soweto

name: Orlando Towers – Rock Climbing
description: Beginner-friendly 25m climbing wall painted in vibrant murals.
address: Cnr Sheffield Rd & Chris Hani Rd, Orlando East, Soweto

name: Kliptown Open Air Museum
cost: Often included in guided tours (approx R500–R900)
description: Outdoor museum in Kliptown where the Freedom Charter was signed. Features powerful exhibitions and local storytelling.
address: Walter Sisulu Square, Union St, Kliptown, Soweto

name: Soweto Bicycle Tours
description: Guided cycling tours through Soweto townships including Vilakazi Street, local shebeens, and historical sites.

name: Soweto Food & Beer Walk
description: Explore Soweto’s culinary and beer culture on foot with local guides, tasting kota, shisa nyama, and craft brews.
